p: Despite the consensus that climate change will have significant implications for global food security, research to date has primarily concentrated on one aspect of food security: availability, with a heavy focus on agricultural food production [ 58]. As a result, there is limited understanding of the measurable impacts climate change will have on non-production components of the food system [ 8]. Thus, many important aspects of food security are being overlooked both in domestic and international climate change and health research, demonstrating the need for a comprehensive conceptual framework.
